alert.note: Alert for Wayne (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 30 at 2:02PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Mississippi, including the following county, Wayne. * WHEN...Until 500 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 159 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated slow moving showers and thunderstorms producing torrential rainfall across much of southern and southwestern Wayne County. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain has likely fallen during the past hour. Excessive runoff from heavy rains will result in ponding of water on area roadways and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and low lying areas. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Clara, Hollis Creek and Smithtown. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
